posts.name: Mitchell
posts.cooked: Hello there, I am a mentor for team 9626, and we are trying to get the code finished for our 2 stage elevator. We were able to get the elevator to position (within 0.01") but the elevator couldn’t hold itself up so we started to increase kG to account for the weight due to gravity. When doing this, we now have an issue of the elevator jumping up 6 inches when enabling the robot, and when getting close to a position holds itself up but oscillates like crazy around that point. Is this just a tuning issue or am I missing something else? Any input is appreciated.
You need to re-tune the other parameters, now that you’ve tuned the gravity constant.

posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked: You need to tune feedforward before your PID . You should be able to reach your set points with just feedforward, PID just allows you to hit those set points with a bit more accuracy and speed. If you have already done this then increasing your D might help.

posts.name: Mitchell
posts.cooked: Thank you, first time actually working with PID so this is good to know. Will give this a try

posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked:

posts.name: Mitchell
posts.cooked:
Thank you for the input. I’ve spent some time testing kg incrementally (increasing by 0.01) trying to find the spot the elevator holds still, I haven’t been able to achieve this and instead get the elevator moving like this

Google Drive file.

Any ideas what I’m missing or is this normal for kg?

posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked: do you have any other constants set?

posts.name: Mitchell
posts.cooked:
These were the constants used for that video, so no I did not

redbarron345:

posts.name: Eli Barnett
posts.cooked: Are you sure?  If there were no other constants the elevator should not have moved when you told it to go to a new position, because there’s no feedback or dynamic feedforward to drive it there.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.name: Mitchell
posts.cooked:
Yes, that video was from last weekend and I retested it tonight under the same circumstances. The only thing applied in that video was the kG value, which is the same thing I saw tonight. I am assuming that something else must be wrong in my code, though I took the template right from WPIlib

Edit: Also let it be known that I checked all the mechanical components and there is no slippage either in the chain or the gearboxes driving the elevator. (2x 21:1 versaplanetaries)
